config.question: Why did the Soviet Union have the bargaining advantage during the Yalta Conference of 1945?

choices.content: The Red Army was close to capturing Berlin.
Stalin gave the United States control over Manchuria.
The Soviet Union had the upper hand in the Pacific struggle.
The United States had withdrawn aid to the Soviet Union.

answer_3.response: While British and American forces were still recovering from the Battle of the Bulge, the Red Army was within fifty miles of Berlin. Stalin drove a series of hard bargains. He refused to give up his plans for communist domination of Poland and the Balkans.
